entry.et: Middle English messangere, from Anglo-French messager, messanger, from message

def.dt: :one who bears a message or does an errand: as
:a dispatch bearer in government or military service
:a light line used in hauling a heavier line (as between ships)
:a substance (as a hormone) that mediates a biological effect

:an RNA produced by transcription that carries the code for a particular protein from the nuclear DNA to a ribosome in the cytoplasm and acts as a template for the formation of that protein compare transfer rna
